title: Citi Launches Prepaid Card in Peru
summary: Lima, Peru - Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS) announced the launch of its new Citi Prepaid Card for corporate and institutional clients in Peru, in partnership with MasterCard®.
tag-1: Citi Launches Prepaid Card in Peru
tag-2: Lima, Peru – Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS) announced the launch of its new Citi Prepaid Card for corporate and institutional clients in Peru, in partnership with MasterCard®.
tag-3: Citi is the leader in innovative Prepaid Services solutions for the corporate and public sectors. With more than 14 years of experience in the prepaid market, its current portfolio includes more than 1,500 public and private sector clients around the world, 25 million cards issued annually, and a portfolio that exceeds US$8 billion. The Citi Prepaid Card is designed to make companies' transactions more efficient and develop faster and more convenient payment solutions for its beneficiaries.
tag-4: Citi Prepaid Cards are a new payment alternative that allows clients to replace expensive payment methods such as cash, checks or vouchers with a secure and efficient electronic payment option. Citi Prepaid Cards offer personalized and flexible benefits capable of designing, implementing and supporting high-volume programs backed by Citi's global network and experience.
tag-5: "Citi Prepaid Card services are a smart, secure and convenient payment system that contribute to efficient budget management for both corporate and public programs, facilitating payment and expense management and considerably reducing the risks and costs associated with carrying cash," commented Mauricio Schwartzmann, Head of Cash Management Solutions and Foreign Trade at Citibank Peru.
tag-6: "For MasterCard," noted Solana Cozzo, Head of MasterCard's Prepaid Area in Latin America and the Caribbean, "this type of initiative represents a valuable opportunity to contribute to social and financial inclusion in the region. The commercial opportunities for prepaid at the global level, and especially in Latin America, are huge, and we are ready to serve the challenges of large-scale and long-term programs alongside a partner like Citibank."
tag-7: Citi Prepaid Cards use existing card technology to enable purchases via POS, Internet or phone and ATM withdrawals anywhere the MasterCard brand is accepted. Prepaid cards are not linked to a bank account or line of credit. The card is preloaded by a private or government institution. Overdrafts are not an option and only the company contracting the service, not card users, can recharge the cards.
tag-8: Prepaid Card applications offer a range of payment solutions depending on the client's needs. Available applications include: promotions (incentives for consumers or distributors, referral programs, discounts, etc.), compensations (payroll, sales commissions, pensions, food vouchers) and expenses (credits, representation fees, petty cash, per diems, etc.).
tag-9: "Citi Prepaid Cards are an innovative solution that transforms traditional payments into a modern electronic payment," remarked Wilfredo Cabrera, Cash Management Products Head. "They serve as additional communications channel to strengthen the client's brand, and their personalization guarantees the security of transactions."
tag-10: Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS) provides comprehensive cash management and trade financing services for multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations across the globe. Using a wide range of digital and mobile platforms, tools and analytical applications, TTS is at the vanguard of the industry when it comes to providing innovative and tailor-made solutions for its clients.
tag-11: TTS offers the market's most complete portfolio of commercial and wealth management solutions, including cash management, payment, accounts receivable, liquidity management and investment services, working capital solutions, commercial and prepaid card programs, and trade financing and services. In first quarter 2013, average deposits and other debit balances totaled US$415 billion.
tag-12: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
